title: Cleveland Police: Suspects arrested in connection with shooting death of 5-year-old
content:
Autoplay:XShooting: 5-year-old killed
CLEVELAND - Cleveland police have arrested a suspect in connection with the shooting death of a 5-year-old boy.
Marlon Hackett Jr, 19, was issued an arrest warrant on Saturday afternoon, police confirm, one day after 5-year-old Ramon D. Burnett was shot and killed during a drive-by shooting in Cleveland. Court documents show he is facing aggravated murder charges but Cleveland police say he has not yet been formally charged.
Dontavious Williams, 18, was charged with aggravated murder in connection with the boy's death.
Earlier Saturday, a vehicle matching the description of the blue Pontiac G6 connected to the fatal shooting of a 5-year-old was towed by police.

The 5-year-old boy was shot in the chest the 2300 block of Louise Harris Drive and transported to MetroHealth Medical Center where he later died.
